title: Web typography: auto leading adjustments according to line length
content:
Hello typophiles!  
I was wondering if anyone has seen this:  
 [http://www.ollicle.com/eg/jquery/autolineheight/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023162103/http:/www.ollicle.com/eg/jquery/autolineheight/ "http://www.ollicle.com/eg/jquery/autolineheight/")

Any thoughts? It is a neat idea for fluid line lengths.

 [‹ The Buzz on the street](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023162103/http:/typophile.com/node/38263 "Go to previous forum topic") [Greek scripts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081023162103/http:/typophile.com/node/32859 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mitchell

comments.content: Nice. Thanks for bringing that up.

That’s pretty cool. I like that the adjustments are fairly subtle (i.e. appropriate), not heavy-handed.

(A warning: It doesn’t seem to work in Safari. I had to look at it with Camino.)
